text: this video explains a growing issue not
only here in Thailand but all over
Southeast Asia Bangkok just happens to
be the center of it all I think a lot of
people are in a hurry they want to like
take away food to their work plastic is
like the best option for them because
you can use it and then you can throw it
away you didn't have to like wash your
dishes the consumption of single-use
plastic items such as shopping bags
straws and water bottles is absurdly
overused a study by the Bangkok
Metropolitan administration showed that
600,000 plastic bags are used every
single day in this city of nine million
people and once you become aware of it
you can't help but notice that plastic
is everywhere if you buy a pen at
7-eleven which is already in a plastic
bag they give you another plastic bag if
you buy this tiny probiotic drink they
give you a plastic bag and a plastic
straw with a plastic wrapper even
bananas are in plastic I mean just look
how loaded they are with plastic at the
register the problem goes way beyond
7-eleven the lighters they have plastic
on them why do these need to be wrapped
in plastic she's absolutely ridiculous
so much plastic here if you buy orange
juice from a street vendor they also
give you a plastic bag with a straw and
a plastic wrapper and have you ever seen
this plastic handle for drinks why can't
you just hold it in your hand and then
you have dozens of touristy Thai islands
such as Phuket and cop√°n yang home of
the full moon party most of the coral
and wildlife in these areas are
completely destroyed but Thailand is
just one small corner of the world this
is a global issue the Ocean Conservancy
predicts that there will be more plastic
in the ocean than fish by the year 2050
and scientists say that 8 million metric
tons of plastic end up each year in our
ocean to put that into perspective
that's roughly a garbage truck
dumping plastic into the sea every
minute or two dumps since you've been
watching this video and it shouldn't
take a genius to know why plastic is bad
for our environment it is harmful to
wildlife mostly in the sea and since
humans eat fish we are directly harmed
with fractions of plastic in every bite
I'm not saying that we need to
completely stop using plastic because
some multi-use recyclable plastic is
fine such as shampoo bottles and milk
joke but disposable plastic items which
make up 50% of all use needs to be cut
back recently there have been efforts to
reduce plastic consumption like
Hurtigruten who has just become the
first cruise line to ban single-use
plastic
adidas has been transforming plastic
pollution into sportswear and just last
week
Starbucks announced that they would go
straw free by 2020 while these are great
initiatives it seems like little has
been done in Bangkok and that needs to
change to be honest with you I haven't
cut down on single-use plastic until
recently when I arrived in Bangkok and
saw it everywhere in my face from now on
I'm going to take action against using
disposable plastic as much as I can and
I urge you to do the same so our kids
and grandkids will live on a much
cleaner earth if everyone watching this
video cuts back on using straws shopping
bags and water bottles could you imagine
the impact we'd have some changes can
make a big difference and it starts
today with you and me I'm drew pinsky
and if you like my travel videos please
click Subscribe and join me as I plan to
visit every country in the world
